title: The Main List
description: Blocks ads, analytics, trackers, crypto-jacking & other such threats/nuisances. Addon lists are available to extend this list.

sources.name: ABP Adblock Warning Removal List
sources.desc: The Adblock Warning Removal List specifically removes obtrusive messages and warnings targeted to users who use an adblocker.

sources.name: ABP filters
sources.desc: Removes circumvention ads in Adblock Plus

sources.name: abuse.ch URLhaus Host file
sources.desc: URLhaus host file does only include domain names associated with malware URLs that are either active (malware sites that currently serve a payload) or that have been added to URLhaus in the past 48 hours

sources.name: AdAway
sources.desc: AdAway is an open source ad blocker for Android using the hosts file

sources.name: AdGuard Annoyances filter
sources.desc: Blocks irritating elements on webpages, including cookie notices, third-party widgets and in-page popups (Doesn’t include social media widgets and buttons, to block them you can still use Social media filter separately). It was inspired by Fanboy Annoyances List, but doesn’t duplicate it, so you can use them both together

sources.name: AdGuard DNS filter
sources.desc: Filter composed of several other filters (AdGuard Base filter, Social media filter, Tracking Protection filter, Mobile ads filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy, etc) and simplified specifically to be better compatible with DNS-level ad blocking.

sources.name: AdGuard Mobile ads filter
sources.desc: Filter that blocks ads on mobile devices. Contains all known mobile ad networks.

sources.name: AdGuard Safari filter
sources.desc: Special filter for Safari 9 and above on iOS and MacOS to use in combination with AdGuard (or other) filter lists. We need a seperate filter because Safari's Content Blocking API does not fully support AdGuard's advanced rules syntax.

sources.name: AdGuard Tracking Protection filter
sources.desc: The most comprehensive list of various online counters and web analytics tools. If you do not want your actions on the Internet be tracked, use this filter.

sources.name: crazy-max's WindowsSpyBlocker (Spy)
sources.desc: Block spying and tracking on Windows systems

sources.name: Dan Pollock’s hosts file
sources.desc: Protects you from many types of spyware, reduces bandwidth use, blocks certain pop-up traps, prevents user tracking by way of \"web bugs\" embedded in spam, provides partial protection to IE from certain web-based exploits and blocks most advertising you would otherwise be subjected to on the internet

sources.name: EasyList Cookie List
sources.desc: EasyList Cookie List blocks cookies banners, GDPR overlay windows and other privacy-related notices

sources.name: EasyList EasyPrivacy
sources.desc: EasyPrivacy is an optional supplementary filter list that completely removes all forms of tracking from the internet, including web bugs, tracking scripts and information collectors, thereby protecting your personal data.

sources.name: Energized Core Hosts
sources.desc: Core Energized Blacklist.

sources.name: FadeMind's add.Risk
sources.desc: Risk content sites based on http://www.hostsfile.org/hosts.html content.

sources.name: FadeMind's add.Spam
sources.desc: Spam sites based on http://www.hostsfile.org/hosts.html content.

sources.name: FadeMind's UncheckyAds
sources.desc: Windows installers ads sources

sources.name: Fanboy's Anti-Cookie Filters
sources.desc: This will remove cookie and privacy warnings (List already included in Annoyances List, don't add list if you're using the Annoyances List)

sources.name: Fanboy's Enhanced Trackers List
sources.desc: Blocks common tracking scripts such as Omniture, Webtrends, Foresee, Coremetrics, Google-Analytics, Touchclarity, ChannelIntelligence.

sources.name: Fanboy's Notifications Blocking List
sources.desc: Specialization: removes website notification popups (included in Fanboy's Annoyances)

sources.name: Geoffrey Frogeye's block list of first-party only trackers
Hexxium Creation's Threat List
sources.desc: Blocks scams/phishing/malware/malvertising/exploits - and other general threats

sources.name: hoshsadiq's NoCoin Filter List
sources.desc: Blocking Web Browser Bitcoin Mining

sources.name: Matomo.org - referrer spammers
sources.desc: This is a community-contributed list of referrer spammers maintained by Matomo, the leading open source web analytics platform.

sources.name: MetaMask's ETH Phishing Detect
sources.desc: Utility for detecting phishing domains targeting Ethereum users.

sources.name: Perflyst and Dandelion Sprout's Smart-TV Blocklist for AdGuard Home
sources.desc: This is a blocklist to block smart-TVs sending metadata back home, sometimes with the added benefit of blocking interface ads for apps and movie services.

sources.name: Personal Blocklist by WaLLy3K
sources.desc: Content added to this list has been manually verified, and is updated irregularly

sources.name: Peter Lowe's Blocklist
sources.desc: Blocklist for use with Adblock Plus

sources.name: Spam404
sources.desc: blocks scam sites

sources.name: Steven Black's ad-hoc list
sources.desc: This is the ad-hoc list from StevenBlack/hosts

sources.name: StopForumSpam
sources.desc: Forum spammers

sources.name: ZeroDot1's CoinBlocker Domains List Optional
sources.desc: An additional list for administrators

sources.name: ZeroDot1's CoinBlocker List
sources.desc: A list for administrators to prevent mining in browsers

sources.name: _internal_filters
sources.desc: internal list

sources.name: _internal_regex_rules
sources.desc: internal list

sources.name: _unblocked_domains
sources.desc: internal list
